袹字的基本解释

袹
bó
〔袹腹〕坎肩儿，背心儿。

袹
mò
古代初丧人用来束发的头巾。
古代男子包发的头巾。

袹字的汉语字典释义

[①]［mò］
［《廣韻》莫白切，入陌，明。］
亦作“袙2”。
(1)见“袹複”。
(2)古代男子包发的头巾。
(3)谓以头巾包裹。参见“袹首”。

袹字的康熙字典解释

【申集下】【衣字部】　袹； 康熙笔画：12； 页码：页1116第05
【唐韻】【集韻】?莫白切，音陌。袹腹也。【博雅】裲襠謂之袹腹。【劉孝標·樂府】裲襠雙心共一袜，袹腹兩邊作一襊。【晉書·齊王囧傳】童謠曰：著布袹腹，爲齊持服。　又【類篇】莫轄切，同帞。【集韻】邪巾袹頭，始喪之服。

袹字的源字形

字形对比：

中国大陆宋体台湾细明体香港明体韩国明朝体
袹字的起名意思

暂无。

Basic explanation of words
Loop
bó
[Half-belly] waistcoat, vest.
Loop
mò
A turban used by early mourners in ancient times to tie their hair.
A turban worn by ancient men.
Loop
Chinese dictionary definition of words
[①]［mò］
["Guangyun" Mo Baiqie, enter the Mo, Ming. ]
Also known as "袙2".
(1) See "recovery".
(2) A turban worn by ancient men.
(3) It is said to be wrapped in a turban. See also "wrapped head".

Kangxi dictionary interpretation of words
[Shen Jixia] [Department of Clothing Characters] 　袹; Kangxi Strokes: 12; Page Number: Page 1116 No. 05
[Tang Yun] [Ji Yun]? Mo Baiqie, Yinmo. The belly is also. [Bo Ya] The crotch is called the belly. 【Liu Xiaobiao·Yuefu】The crotch and the two hearts share one socks, and the two sides of the belly are made of a sock. [Book of Jin·The Biography of the King of Qi] The nursery rhyme said: Wearing cloth on the abdomen is for Qi to hold clothes.　[Classic articles] Mo Jueqie, the same. [Jiyun] The evil scarf is wrapped around the head, and the clothing of mourning begins.
